result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter D Risper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Pandering/Pimping, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.33(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 207 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for legal employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Ms. West, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Contact with Ms. Seisser at the discretion of the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Theresa W, Heidi S, Cameron S, Raymond W, Amy K, Value Inn in Kenosha, or Econo Lodge in Waukegan, IL, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No escort services, either newspaper or computer, not use any computer services unless approved by agent.
ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3/23/16 - Sentencing Hearing
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Baumgardner.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 276 days served, 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; no contact w/Theresa W., Heidi S., Cameron S., Raymond W. or Amy K, Value Inn in Kenosha or Econo Lodge in Waukegan, IL.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Baumgardner.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Baumgardner requests adjournment to allow her to check on sentence credit in IL.  SEHR adjourned to 3/23/16 at 2pm.
Cassi Baumgardner  kmk
At the request of DOC Agt Brittany Spencer a SEHR is set for 3/16/16 at 2:30pm.
Revocation packet.

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 2/19/16; to be returned to court for sentencing.  Partial payment made; balance still due.  kmk
Originally forfeited 5/27/14
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  ADA Phan requests adjournment, believes she can get one of the witnesses to appear for trial; states there was information provided to Atty Koesser last week, states that there is new evidence that will result in new charges against the deft unless case is resolved, needs to provide copies of new discovery to Atty Koesser.  Atty Koesser objects to adjournment.  Court grants adjournment of trial for consolidation of cases; reset to 4/6/15 at 9am, pick & go; JSH 3/19/15 at 1:15pm.  Atty Koesser moves to modify bond.  Court denies request to modify bond for reasons set forth on the record.  After a conference held off the record with his client, Atty Koesser reports that the case is resolved.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; credit for 207 days served if revoked; submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; cash bonds paid are reinstated and to be applied to extradition costs of $143.83 and court costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.
